\begin{align} \int \left(\sqrt{x} - \dfrac{1}{\sqrt{x}}\right)^2dx &= \int \left(x + \dfrac{1}{x} -2\right)dx\\ &= \int x\,dx + \int \dfrac{1}{x}\,dx - 2\int 1\,dx\\ &= \dfrac{x^2}{2} + \log \vert x \vert + 2x + C \end{align}\\
\text{Here C is constant of Integration}\\
